attributes.action: Not create a database of emails, text messages and other private communication`
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Information from London (Reuters) 

A massive government database which would store everybody's e-mails, Internet information, phone-calls and text messages is being considered to help security forces in the fight against crime and terrorism.
The home office is considering plans to keep this information about everyone on huge databases. If this is allowed it will be the final nail in the coffin for civil liberties. We can not allow this government to contain to allow our rights to be eroded in the name of fighting terrorism. If you value your rights and privacy, please sign this petition.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
